thread.title: Calipari picks All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team
thread.title_full: Calipari picks All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team

title: Calipari picks All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team
text:
Manage Calipari picks All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team In an interview with Bleacher Report, John Calipari picked his All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team. Who's his starting five? Slot to Kentucky Links 
Kentucky coach John Calipari has long-said that his goal is to have half of the NBA All-Star Game made up of his guys. 
While there will only be three former Wildcats in this year's game in New Orleans, there are several others on the doorstep including NBA Rookie of the Year Karl-Anthony Towns , Devin Booker , Eric Bledsoe and others. 
In an exclusive interview with Bleacher Report conducted in January, Calipari was asked if a team made up of former Kentucky players could compete for an NBA championship. 
From there, the conversation segued to, among other things, his All-Kentucky NBA Dream Team. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
B/R: OK, let's say it's completely hypothetical then. Who's your starting five? I got my five right here. 
Calipari: Well, Anthony Davis . John Wall . Karl Towns. I'd probably play DeMarcus Cousins and let Anthony be a 3. And what would the last position be? Shooting guard? I'd probably say Devin Booker. 
Davis, Wall and Cousins are all slated to participate in this weekend's NBA All-Star Game in New Orleans while Davis, Wall, Cousins and Booker will all participate in the Taco Bell Skills Challenge. 
Towns and Booker, along with Trey Lyles and Jamal Murray , will compete in the NBA Rising Stars Challenge and former Wildcats Dakari Johnson and Alex Poythress were named to the NBA D-League All-Star Game. Author
